name: CrowdStrike
description: Displays information from relevant Crowdstrike Falcon detections based on searching behavioral indicators (process hashes, filenames) and device information (IPv4 address).

options.name: CrowdStrike API URL
options.description: The REST API URL for your CrowdStrike instance which should include the schema (i.e., http, https) and port if required.

options.name: CrowdStrike UI URL
options.description: The URL for your CrowdStrike UI instance

options.name: Client ID
options.description: The Client ID to use to connect to CrowdStrike.

options.name: Client Secret
options.description: The secret associated with the Client ID. At a minimum, the API key must have 'Read' access to the 'Detections' scope.

options.name: Search CrowdStrike IOCs
options.description: If checked, the integration will search IOCs detected in your environment.  IOCs (indicators of compromise) are artifacts that include SHA256, MD5 or domain values.  The provided API key must have 'Read' access to the 'IOC Manager APIs' scope for this option to work.

options.name: Allow Containment Status Change
options.description: If checked, users will be able to change the Containment Status of Devices via the integration.  The provided API key must have 'Read' and 'Write' access to the 'Hosts' scope for this option to work.  This option must be set to "Users can view only".

options.name: Enable Real Time Response
options.description: If checked, users will be able to connect to hosts and run commands, and Custom and Falcon Real Time Response scripts.

options.name: Enabled Real Time Response Commands
options.description: Comma delimited list of enabled RTR commands by command name.  Listed commands must be accessible to the configured Client ID. Command names are case-sensitive. The `Enable Real Time Response` option must be checked for this setting to have an effect. This setting must be locked for all users.
options.default: cat, cd, env, getsid, ipconfig, ls, netstat, ps

options.name: Enabled Falcon Real Time Response Scripts
options.description: Comma delimited list of enabled Falcon scripts by script name.  Listed Falcon scripts must be accessible to the configured Client ID. Script names are case-sensitive. The `Enable Real Time Response` option must be checked for this setting to have an effect.  This setting must be locked for all users.
options.default: LocalUser, RegisteredAV, PowerShellEnv, Monitor, LocalGroup, LastBootUpTime, FirewallRule, EventSource, EventLog, BitLocker, FileInfo, ScheduledTask, Service, SSID, Printer, NetworkShare, Process, RegistryKey, Prefetch, InstalledProgram

options.name: Enabled Custom Real Time Response Scripts
options.description: Comma delimited list of enabled Custom scripts by script name. Listed Custom scripts must be accessible to the configured Client ID. Script names are case-sensitive. The `Enable Real Time Response` option must be checked for this setting to have an effect. This setting must be locked for all users.

options.name: Minimum Severity for Detections
options.description: The minimum severity level required for Detections to be displayed.  Defaults to 'Low'.

options.name: Detection Statuses
options.description: Detection statuses you would like to return results for.

options.name: Max Concurrent Requests
options.description: Maximum number of concurrent requests.  Integration must be restarted after changing this option. Defaults to 20.

options.name: Minimum Time Between Lookups
options.description: Minimum amount of time in milliseconds between lookups. Integration must be restarted after changing this option. Defaults to 100.
